clusterList.phrase: we've got a rapidly ageing population so governments generally are going to have to look in the future at investing more into aged care facilities
it the care of elderly australians has to be a big focus there's no doubt that greater investments are required

the impact of this is stark current trends suggest the uk will have its first 120 year old in the early 2060s if not before that means she is already drawing her state pension and will do so for half her lifetime

given that the us population age 65 and older is expected to more than double to 72 million by 2030 expanding the reach of evidence based programs like healthier living to promote self care also makes good clinical and economic sense
